subject: Re: [junit] Replacing Logger class
msgSnippet: Rakesh, Would it be possible, rather than making calls directly against the log4j classes, to call thin wrappers that you control, that you can turn off during
messageBody:
Rakesh,

Would it be possible, rather than making calls directly against the
log4j classes, to call thin wrappers that you control, that you can turn
off during testing?

David Saff

Rakesh Patel wrote:

> Hi All,
>
> Does anyone know how to disable log4j logging when running tests.
> Reading through Junit in Action (excellent btw) it shows an example
> where code is refactored in such a way that the Logger is actually
> mocked out. Unfortunately, I cannot see how to do this with log4j since
> it is a class rather than an interface.
>
> Any help appreciated!
>
> Thanks
>
> Rakesh
>
> PS I am using the 1.3 alpha release version of log4j which has a bug -
> logger creation always logs even when you turn logging off.
>
